clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Investigate the Efficacy and Safety of a Single Injection of Corifollitropin Alfa (Organon 36286) for Ovarian Stimulation Using Daily Recombinant Follicle Stimulating Hormone (FSH) as Reference (P05787)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomized, Double-Blind, Active-Controlled, Non-Inferiority Clinical Trial to Investigate the Efficacy and Safety of a Single Injection of Org 36286 (Corifollitropin Alfa) to Induce Multifollicular Development for Controlled Ovarian Stimulation Using Daily Recombinant FSH as Reference

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the efficacy and safety of a single injection of 150 μg Corifollitropin Alfa (Organon 36286) to induce multifollicular development for controlled ovarian stimulation using daily recombinant FSH (recFSH) as a reference. The primary hypothesis is that a single injection of Corifollitropin Alfa is non-inferior to daily treatment with recFSH in initiating multifollicular growth.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized, double-blind, active-controlled, non-inferiority clinical trial investigating the efficacy and safety of a new treatment regimen with Corifollitropin Alfa, a recombinant gonadotropin applied to initiate and sustain follicular stimulation in controlled ovarian stimulation for Assisted Reproductive Technology (ART). For this regimen, participants receive a single injection of Corifollitropin Alfa and one week later, treatment is continued with daily recFSH up to the day of triggering final oocyte maturation. In the reference group participants receive daily injections of recFSH up to the day of triggering final oocyte maturation. Non-inferiority in ongoing pregnancy rates (assessed at least 10 weeks after embryo transfer) will be the primary endpoint for this trial. The number of oocytes retrieved will be analyzed as co-primary endpoint.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With an Ongoing Pregnancy (Ongoing Pregnancy Rate)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at least 10 weeks after embryo transfer (up to 1 year)
primary_outcome.description: An ongoing pregnancy is a fetus with heart activity at least 10 weeks after embryo transfer as assessed by Ultrasound Scan (USS) or Doppler or is confirmed by live birth. The ongoing pregnancy rate is 100 times the number of participants with an ongoing pregnancy after embryo transfer, divided by the total number of participants who started treatment. Calculations were made per attempt, meaning that participants who did not have embryo transfers were considered not pregnant.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 hours after administration of hCG (up to 1 year)
primary_outcome.description: Up to 36 hours after receiving hCG, cumulus-oocyte-complexes were retrieved. Mean numbers retrieved were calculated per attempt, meaning that if a participant did not reach this stage in In Vitro Fertilization (IVF) treatment, zero values were imputed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Amount of Recombinant FSH Needed to Induce Multifollicular Development Starting at Day 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to day of hCG treatment (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of recFSH administered for a participant to reach 3 follicles >= 17 mm, starting from treatment Day 1 onwards.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Amount of Recombinant FSH Needed to Induce Multifollicular Development Starting at Day 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 8 to Day of hCG treatment (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of recFSH administered for a participant to reach 3 follicles >= 17 mm, starting from treatment Day 8 onwards.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum FSH Levels During Stimulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to day of hCG treatment (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean serum FSH are presented over one Controlled Ovarian Stimulation (COS) cycle: from Day 1 (Pre-dose) up to the day of hCG treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Luteinizing Hormone (LH) Levels During Stimulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to day of hCG treatment (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean serum LH levels are presented over one COS cycle: from Day 1 (Pre-dose) up to the day of hCG treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Estradiol (E2) Levels During Stimulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to day of hCG treatment (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean serum E2 levels are presented over one COS cycle: from Day 1 (Pre-dose) up to the day of hCG treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Progesterone (P) Levels During Stimulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to day of hCG treatment (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean serum P levels are presented over one COS cycle: from Day 1 (Pre-dose) up to day of hCG treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Inhibin-B Levels During Stimulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to day of hCG treatment (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean serum Inhibin-B levels are presented over one COS cycle: from Day 1 (Pre-dose) up to day of hCG treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Follicles Categorized by Size on Stimulation Day 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On Day 1 of treatment (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Ovaries were assessed during stimulation by ultrasonographic investigation (USS), and the mean number of follicles are categorized by their size.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Follicles Categorized by Size on Stimulation Day 5
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On Day 5 of treatment (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Ovaries were assessed during stimulation by USS, and the mean number of follicles are categorized by their size.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Follicles Categorized by Size on Stimulation Day 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On Day 8 of treatment (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Ovaries were assessed during stimulation by USS, and the mean number of follicles are categorized by their size.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Follicles Categorized by Size on the Day of hCG
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day of HCG treatment (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Ovaries were assessed during stimulation by USS, and the mean number of follicles are categorized by their size.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Cumulus-oocyte-complexes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 hours after administration of hCG (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Prior to IVF the mean number of cumulus-oocyte-complexes used for IVF was assessed

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Oocytes Assessed Prior to Intracytoplasmic Sperm Injection (ICSI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 hours after administration of hCG (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of oocytes used for ICSI was assessed, and categorized based on their quality

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Fertilized Oocytes (Fertilization Rate)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 18 hours after start of fertilization (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: The fertilization rate is 100 times the number of fertilized 2 pro-nuclei (2PN) oocytes obtained, divided by the number of oocytes fertilized by IVF or ICSI

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Embryos Obtained on Day 3 Categorized by Quality
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post fertilization Day 3 (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Embryos obtained on Day 3 were categorized by their qualiity as follows: Grade 1: excellent: No fragmentation, 6-10 cells, and equal blastomere size taking the impact of cell division into account. Grade 2: good: < 20% fragmentation, 6-10 cells, and equal blastomere size taking the impact of cell division into account. Grade 3: fair: 20-50% fragmentation and/or less than 6 cells and/or multinucleation (if observed). Other Grade: Embryos that do not qualify as Grades 1, 2 or 3. Grades 1 and 2 are considered good quality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Embryos Transferred on Day 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post fertilization Day 3 (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: After fertilization, the mean number of embryos transferred on Day 3 were assessed. Total and good quality embryos are presented, with good quality embryos, Grades 1 and 2, defined as the following: Grade 1: excellent: No fragmentation, 6-10 cells, and equal blastomere size taking the impact of cell division into account. Grade 2: good: < 20% fragmentation, 6-10 cells, and equal blastomere size taking the impact of cell division into account.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Gestational Sacs (Implantation Rate)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 weeks after embryo transfer (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: The implantation rate is 100 times the number of gestational sacs assessed by USS after embryo transfer, divided by the number of embryos transferred.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Miscarriage (Miscarriage Rate) Per Clinical Pregnancy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to day of miscarriage (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: The miscarriage rate is 100 times the number of miscarriages, divided by the number of clinical pregnancies assessed by USS. A clinical pregnancy is the presence of at least one gestational sac or confirmed by live birth.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Miscarriage (Miscarriage Rate) Per Vital Pregnancy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to day of miscarriage (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: The miscarriage rate is 100 times the number of miscarriages, divided by the number of vital pregnancies assessed by USS. A vital pregnancy is the presence of at least one fetus with heart activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Biochemical Pregnancy (Pregnancy Rate) Per Attempt
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks after embryo transfer (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Biochemical pregnancy was assessed by measuring serum or urinary hCG. Per attempt means that if a participant did not reach the stage of pregnancy assessment zero values were imputed. The pregnancy rate is 100 times the number of participants with pregnancies detected, divided by the number of participants assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Biochemical Pregnancy (Pregnancy Rate) Per Embryo Transfer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks after embryo transfer (up to 1 year)
secondary_outcome.description: Biochemical pregnancy was assessed for participants who had embryo transfer by measuring serum or urinary hCG. The pregnancy rate is 100 times the number of participants with pregnancies detected, divided by the number of participants assessed.

arm_group.description: Participants received a single subcutaneous (SC) injection of 150 µg Corifollitropin Alfa (org 36286) on day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle (Stimulation Day 1); 7 daily SC injections from Stimulation Days 1 to 7 with placebo-recFSH; followed by daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH up to the day of hCG. Daily SC injections of Ganirelix were administered from Stimulation Day 5 to the day of hCG; at which time a single dose of hCG was given when 3 follicles >= 17 mm. On the day of oocyte pick up (OPU) daily doses of progesterone were started and continued for up to 6 weeks or menses.

Participants received a single SC injection of placebo Corifollitropin Alfa on day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle (Stimulation Day 1); 7 daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH from Stimulation Days 1 to 7; followed by daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH up to the day of hCG. Daily SC injections of Ganirelix were given from Stimulation Day 5 to the day of hCG; at which time a single dose of hCG was administered when 3 follicles >= 17 mm. On the day of OPU daily doses of progesterone were started and continued for up to 6 weeks or menses.

intervention.description: On the morning of day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle (Stimulation Day 1), a single SC injection of 150 μg (0.5 mL) Corifollitropin Alfa was administered in the abdominal wall.
Daily SC injections with 200 IU fixed dose recFSH were started on Stimulation Day 1 and continued up to and including Stimulation Day 7.

Pre-filled syringe containing an identical solution when compared to Corifollitropin Alfa. On the morning of day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle (Stimulation Day 1), a single SC injection was administered in the abdominal wall.

Identical ready-for-use solution, but without the active ingedient, supplied in cartridges for SC injection with the Follistim Pen. Daily SC injections were started on Stimulation Day 1 and continued up to and including Stimulation Day 7.
From Stimulation Day 8 onwards a daily SC dose of 200 IU recFSH was administered up to and including the Day of hCG.
On Stimulation Day 5 a daily SC injection of 0.25 mg was started, which continued up to and including the day of hCG
When 3 follicles >= 17 mm were observed by USS, a single dose of 10,000 IU/USP hCG was administered; or, for those at risk for Ovarian Hyperstimulation Syndrome (OHSS), a lower dose of 5,000 IU/USP

On the day of OPU, luteal phase support was started by administering micronized progesterone of at least 600 mg/day vaginally, or at least 50 mg/day intramuscular (IM), which continued for at least 6 weeks, or up to menses.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of 1509 randomized participants, 1506 received treatment with either Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH (Intent-to Treat population [ITT]).

group.title: 150 µg Corifollitropin Alfa
group.description: Participants received a single subcutaneous (SC) injection of 150 µg Corifollitropin Alfa on day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle (Stimulation Day 1); 7 daily SC injections from Stimulation Days 1 to 7 with placebo-recombinant Follicle Stimulating Hormone (recFSH); followed by daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH up to the day of human Chorionogonadotropin (hCG); multiple daily SC injections of Ganirelix were given from Stimulation Day 5 to the day of hCG; a single dose of hCG was administered when 3 follicles >= 17 mm were observed; and on the day of oocyte pick up (OPU) daily doses of progesterone were started and continued for up to 6 weeks or menses.

group.title: 200 IU recFSH
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of placebo Corifollitropin Alfa on day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle (Stimulation Day 1); 7 daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH from Stimulation Days 1 to 7; followed by daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH up to the day of hCG; multiple daily SC injections of Ganirelix were given from Stimulation Day 5 to the day of hCG; single dose of hCG was administered when 3 follicles >= 17 mm were observed; and on the day of OPU daily doses of progesterone were started and continued for up to 6 weeks or menses.

baseline.population: The ITT group consisting of randomized participants treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH

group.title: 200 IU recFSH

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With an Ongoing Pregnancy (Ongoing Pregnancy Rate)
outcome.description: An ongoing pregnancy is a fetus with heart activity at least 10 weeks after embryo transfer as assessed by Ultrasound Scan (USS) or Doppler or is confirmed by live birth. The ongoing pregnancy rate is 100 times the number of participants with an ongoing pregnancy after embryo transfer, divided by the total number of participants who started treatment. Calculations were made per attempt, meaning that participants who did not have embryo transfers were considered not pregnant.

outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) population consisting of all randomized participants who were treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH, and grouped according to the treatment they were randomized to.

group.title: 150 µg Corifollitropin Alfa
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of 150 µg Corifollitropin Alfa on day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle (Stimulation Day 1); 7 daily SC injections from Stimulation Days 1 to 7 with placebo-recFSH; followed by daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH up to the day of hCG; multiple daily SC injections of Ganirelix were given from Stimulation Day 5 to the day of hCG; a single dose of hCG was administered when 3 follicles >= 17 mm were observed; and on the day of OPU daily doses of progesterone were started and continued for up to 6 weeks or menses.

group.title: 200 IU recFSH
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of placebo Corifollitropin Alfa on day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle (Stimulation Day 1); 7 daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH from Stimulation Days 1 to 7; followed by daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH up to the day of hCG; multiple daily SC injections of Ganirelix were given from Stimulation Day 5 to the day of hCG; single dose of hCG was administered when 3 follicles >= 17 mm were observed; and on the day of OPU daily doses of progesterone were started and continued for up to 6 weeks or menses.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With an Ongoing Pregnancy (Ongoing Pregnancy Rate)
measure.description: An ongoing pregnancy is a fetus with heart activity at least 10 weeks after embryo transfer as assessed by Ultrasound Scan (USS) or Doppler or is confirmed by live birth. The ongoing pregnancy rate is 100 times the number of participants with an ongoing pregnancy after embryo transfer, divided by the total number of participants who started treatment. Calculations were made per attempt, meaning that participants who did not have embryo transfers were considered not pregnant.
measure.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) population consisting of all randomized participants who were treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH, and grouped according to the treatment they were randomized to.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Treatment groups were formally compared with a generalized linear model for the ongoing pregnancy rate which included factors for treatment group, age at randomization, and region. A pre-defined non-inferiority margin of 8% was applied.

outcome.title: Mean Number of Oocytes Retrieved
outcome.description: Up to 36 hours after receiving hCG, cumulus-oocyte-complexes were retrieved. Mean numbers retrieved were calculated per attempt, meaning that if a participant did not reach this stage in In Vitro Fertilization (IVF) treatment, zero values were imputed.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 hours after administration of hCG (up to 1 year)
outcome.population: ITT population consisting of all randomized participants who were treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH, and grouped according to the treatment they were randomized to.

group.title: 150 µg Corifollitropin Alfa
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of 150 µg Corifollitropin Alfa on day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle (Stimulation Day 1); 7 daily SC injections from Stimulation Days 1 to 7 with placebo-recFSH; followed by daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH up to the day of hCG; multiple daily SC injections of Ganirelix were given from Stimulation Day 5 to the day of hCG; a single dose of hCG was administered when 3 follicles >= 17 mm were observed; and on the day of OPU daily doses of progesterone were started and continued for up to 6 weeks or menses.

group.title: 200 IU recFSH
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of placebo Corifollitropin Alfa on day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle (Stimulation Day 1); 7 daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH from Stimulation Days 1 to 7; followed by daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH up to the day of hCG; multiple daily SC injections of Ganirelix were given from Stimulation Day 5 to the day of hCG; single dose of hCG was administered when 3 follicles >= 17 mm were observed; and on the day of OPU daily doses of progesterone were started and continued for up to 6 weeks or menses.

measure.title: Mean Number of Oocytes Retrieved
measure.description: Up to 36 hours after receiving hCG, cumulus-oocyte-complexes were retrieved. Mean numbers retrieved were calculated per attempt, meaning that if a participant did not reach this stage in In Vitro Fertilization (IVF) treatment, zero values were imputed.
measure.population: ITT population consisting of all randomized participants who were treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH, and grouped according to the treatment they were randomized to.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Equivalence margins of -3 and +5 were applied for the difference in number of oocytes. If the 95% confidence interval of the difference exceeded -3 or +5 oocytes, then Corifollitropin Alfa treatment was not considered equivalent to the reference treatment (recFSH).
analysis.p_value_desc: Treatment groups were formally compared including covariates treatment group, age and center.

outcome.title: Percentage of Fertilized Oocytes (Fertilization Rate)
outcome.description: The fertilization rate is 100 times the number of fertilized 2 pro-nuclei (2PN) oocytes obtained, divided by the number of oocytes fertilized by IVF or ICSI
outcome.time_frame: Up to 18 hours after start of fertilization (up to 1 year)
outcome.population: ITT population consisting of all randomized participants who were treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH, and grouped according to the treatment they were randomized to.Restricted to participants with IVF and/or ICSI.

group.title: 150 µg Corifollitropin Alfa

measure.title: Percentage of Fertilized Oocytes (Fertilization Rate)
measure.description: The fertilization rate is 100 times the number of fertilized 2 pro-nuclei (2PN) oocytes obtained, divided by the number of oocytes fertilized by IVF or ICSI
measure.population: ITT population consisting of all randomized participants who were treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH, and grouped according to the treatment they were randomized to.Restricted to participants with IVF and/or ICSI.

outcome.title: Number of Embryos Obtained on Day 3 Categorized by Quality
outcome.description: Embryos obtained on Day 3 were categorized by their qualiity as follows: Grade 1: excellent: No fragmentation, 6-10 cells, and equal blastomere size taking the impact of cell division into account. Grade 2: good: < 20% fragmentation, 6-10 cells, and equal blastomere size taking the impact of cell division into account. Grade 3: fair: 20-50% fragmentation and/or less than 6 cells and/or multinucleation (if observed). Other Grade: Embryos that do not qualify as Grades 1, 2 or 3. Grades 1 and 2 are considered good quality.
outcome.time_frame: Post fertilization Day 3 (up to 1 year)
outcome.population: ITT population consisting of all randomized participants who were treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH, and grouped according to the treatment they were randomized to. Restricted to participants with IVF and/or ICSI, and excludes those who had embryos transferred or cryopreserved before Day 3.

Grade 2: good: < 20% fragmentation, 6-10 cells, and equal blastomere size taking the impact of cell division into account. Grade 3: fair: 20-50% fragmentation and/or less than 6 cells and/or multinucleation (if observed). Other Grade: Embryos that do not qualify as Grades 1, 2 or 3. outcome.title: Number of Embryos Transferred on Day 3
outcome.description: After fertilization, the mean number of embryos transferred on Day 3 were assessed. Total and good quality embryos are presented, with good quality embryos, Grades 1 and 2, defined as the following: Grade 1: excellent: No fragmentation, 6-10 cells, and equal blastomere size taking the impact of cell division into account. Grade 2: good: < 20% fragmentation, 6-10 cells, and equal blastomere size taking the impact of cell division into account.

outcome.population: ITT population consisting of all randomized participants who were treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH, and grouped according to the treatment they were randomized to. Restricted to participants with embryo transfer.

outcome.description: The implantation rate is 100 times the number of gestational sacs assessed by USS after embryo transfer, divided by the number of embryos transferred.

outcome.population: ITT population consisting of all randomized participants who were treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH, and grouped according to the treatment they were randomized to. Restricted to participants with embryo transfer.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Miscarriage (Miscarriage Rate) Per Clinical Pregnancy
outcome.description: The miscarriage rate is 100 times the number of miscarriages, divided by the number of clinical pregnancies assessed by USS. A clinical pregnancy is the presence of at least one gestational sac or confirmed by live birth.
outcome.time_frame: Up to day of miscarriage (up to 1 year)
outcome.population: ITT population consisting of all randomized participants who were treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH, and grouped according to the treatment they were randomized to. Restricted to participants with a clinical pregnancy.

group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of 150 µg Corifollitropin Alfa on day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle (Stimulation Day 1); 7 daily SC injections from Stimulation Days 1 to 7 with placebo-recFSH; followed by daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH up to the day of hCG; multiple daily SC injections of Ganirelix were given from Stimulation Day 5 to the day of hCG; a single dose of hCG was administered when 3 follicles >= 17 mm were observed; and on the day of OPU daily doses of progesterone were started and continued for up to 6 weeks or menses.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Miscarriage (Miscarriage Rate) Per Clinical Pregnancy
measure.description: The miscarriage rate is 100 times the number of miscarriages, divided by the number of clinical pregnancies assessed by USS. A clinical pregnancy is the presence of at least one gestational sac or confirmed by live birth.
measure.population: ITT population consisting of all randomized participants who were treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH, and grouped according to the treatment they were randomized to. Restricted to participants with a clinical pregnancy.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Miscarriage (Miscarriage Rate) Per Vital Pregnancy
outcome.description: The miscarriage rate is 100 times the number of miscarriages, divided by the number of vital pregnancies assessed by USS. A vital pregnancy is the presence of at least one fetus with heart activity.
outcome.time_frame: Up to day of miscarriage (up to 1 year)
outcome.population: ITT population consisting of all randomized participants who were treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH, and grouped according to the treatment they were randomized to. Restricted to participants with a vital pregnancy.

group.title: 150 µg Corifollitropin Alfa
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of 150 µg Corifollitropin Alfa on day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle (Stimulation Day 1); 7 daily SC injections from Stimulation Days 1 to 7 with placebo-recFSH; followed by daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH up to the day of hCG; multiple daily SC injections of Ganirelix were given from Stimulation Day 5 to the day of hCG; a single dose of hCG was administered when 3 follicles >= 17 mm were observed; and on the day of OPU daily doses of progesterone were started and continued for up to 6 weeks or menses.

group.title: 200 IU recFSH
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of placebo Corifollitropin Alfa on day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle (Stimulation Day 1); 7 daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH from Stimulation Days 1 to 7; followed by daily SC injections with 200 IU recFSH up to the day of hCG; multiple daily SC injections of Ganirelix were given from Stimulation Day 5 to the day of hCG; single dose of hCG was administered when 3 follicles >= 17 mm were observed; and on the day of OPU daily doses of progesterone were started and continued for up to 6 weeks or menses.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Miscarriage (Miscarriage Rate) Per Vital Pregnancy
measure.description: The miscarriage rate is 100 times the number of miscarriages, divided by the number of vital pregnancies assessed by USS. A vital pregnancy is the presence of at least one fetus with heart activity.
measure.population: ITT population consisting of all randomized participants who were treated with Corifollitropin Alfa or recFSH, and grouped according to the treatment they were randomized to. Restricted to participants with a vital pregnancy.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Biochemical Pregnancy (Pregnancy Rate) Per Attempt
outcome.description: Biochemical pregnancy was assessed by measuring serum or urinary hCG. Per attempt means that if a participant did not reach the stage of pregnancy assessment zero values were imputed. The pregnancy rate is 100 times the number of participants with pregnancies detected, divided by the number of participants assessed.
outcome.time_frame: Two weeks after embryo transfer (up to 1 year)

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 10 weeks after embryo transfer (up to 1 year)
reported_events.desc: The All-Subjects-Treated (AST) group. AST is based on the treatment actually received. Two participants randomized to the 150 µg Corifollitropin Alfa treatment group were actually treated with 200 IU recFSH, whereas one participant randomized to the 200 IU recFSH treatment group was actually treated with 150 µg Corifollitropin Alfa.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: All publications must be based on data validated and released by the Sponsor. Any scientific paper, presentation or other communication concerning this clinical trial will first be submitted to the Sponsor at least six weeks before publication or presentation. The Sponsor shall have the right to make its consent conditional upon proper representation of the interpretation of both the Sponsor and the investigator(s) in the discussion of the data in such communications.
